Such is the picture represented to us of the first '‘beginnings of a community settling itself in a remote and forlom district, where it was destined to acquire extensive territory, and for centuries to exercise an important influence on the surrounding population. “ Whether strictly true in the details or not, it is doubt- ·less correct as a general delineation. It is probably authentic, since, though we have it from a hand later by two centuries than the event, Ι shall be able to show that it was drawn from early authority.
